awd_titl_txt: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2022 IEEE Security Development (SecDev) Conference
awd_abstract_narration:
This project supports student attendance at the 2022 IEEE Cyber Security Development (SecDev) conference to be held in Atlanta in October 2022. Research on software security usually focuses on detecting vulnerabilities in software and attacks on resources. However, there is little attention to how programmers can develop secure software from the ground up. This conference series on Secure Development (SecDev) focuses on this important area. The 2022 IEEE SecDev Conference aims to continue its mission of providing a forum where researchers, practitioners, and decision-makers can meet to discuss ideas that focus on building-in security into our systems. The support for the conference is important for educating and training the workforce in this area and helping provide a pathway to research careers. The technical advances presented by the conference are critical to the development of secure software, which is important to society.

SecDev encourages students to consider big ideas that lead to a stimulating, thoughtful, and perhaps (gently) provocative discussion. This project sponsors travel expenses for students to attend the conference. Participation in the conference provides students with opportunities to observe high-quality presentations and interact with senior researchers in the field, consequently exerting a positive impact on the quality of their research. The training and development of students in this way also help widen the talent pool of professionals and researchers focused on addressing the challenges of developing critical secure systems and services, leading to potential new areas of inquiry in this domain. This project also broadens the participation in the conference of underrepresented students in computing.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK

por.por_cntn:
Dear Dr. Oliveira,

From Oct October 18 - 20, 2022, IEEE SecDev held its fifth conference at Georgia Tech Hotel and Conference Center, Atlanta, GA. This was the first year that the conference resumed in-person meetings after the pandemic. The participants were from a broad range of the industry and academia, from across North America and Europe.


SecDev actively recruits student participation and encourages and supports financial sponsors to conduct new graduate recruiting at SecDev, as well as supporting their diversity initiatives. The 2022 SecDev student travel grant was open to PhD, Masters, and undergraduate students. The grant was given priority to students who have been involved in research projects with an advisor. The conference made substantial efforts to recruit minority candidates, specifically from Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCU) and candidates from scholarship for service (SFS) schools. To protect against conflicts of interest, the selection committee ensured that they were not selecting their own students.

Direct recruitment attempts were performed at 50 universities:


University          HBCU SFS Applicants
Boston University 1
Bowie State University X
Clemson University 4
Coppin University X
Georgia Institute of Technology X
Hampton University X
Howard University X
Lincoln University of Pennsylvania X
Morgan State University X
North Carolina A&T State University X
Northwestern University 1
Oklahoma State University 2
Rowan University 2
State University of New York at Binghamton X
The College of William and Marry 1
Univeristy of Alabama X
University at Buffalo, SUNY X 3
University of Alabama Birmingham X 2
University of Alaska Anchorage
University of Arkansas Fayetteville
University of Colorado Boulder 2
University of Connecticut
University of Delaware
University of Florida
University of Hawaii at Hilo
University of Hawaii at Manoa X
University of Idaho
University of Kansas
University of Kentucky
University of Louisiana 1
University of Maine
University of Maryland X
University of Massachusetts, Amherst X
University of Mississippi
University of Missouri X 3
University of Montana
University of Nebraska
University of Nevada
University of New Hampshire
University of New Mexico X
University of Rhode Island X
University of Texas at Dallas X 1
University of South Carolina
University of Southern California 3
University of the District of Columbia X
University of Vermont
University of Virginia 1
Virginia Tech 1
Virginia State University X
West Virginia State University X


By the numbers for the 2022 NSF Student Travel Grants:

28 submitted applications

12 students awarded

11 completed registrations

8 self-identified as minority (4 female students and 4 from under-represented groups)

Up to $1250 in reimbursements per student


This resulted in a disbursement of $13,531.83 in travel dollars. $1,250 was reserved for one female graduate student from Rowan University who did not attend the conference. It seems the student had a conflict with the time and eventually could not make the trip.


The NSF travel grant was highly focused on minority and underrepresented groups, and detailed information on the student awardees is given in the following table, we believe we were successful in reaching out to a community not normally represented in the field.


Name                  Email                                   Affiliation   Gender
Douglas Everson deverso@clemson.edu Clemson University Male
Md Mahir Asef Kabir mdmahirasefk@vt.edu Virginia Tech Male
Tianyi Yang tyang170@usc.edu University of Southern California Male
Alicia Esquivel Morel ace6qv@mail.missouri.edu University of Missouri at Columbia Female
Ebuka Johnbosco Okpala eokpala@clemson.edu Clemson University Male
Zhenpeng Shi zpshi@bu.edu Boston University Male
Song Liao liao5@g.clemson.edu Clemson University Male
Sylvia Patricia Llosa syll7976@colorado.edu University of Colorado Boulder Female
Roshan Lal Neupane neupaner@missouri.edu University of Missouri-Columbia Male
Hamza Khalid xtg7bw@virginia.edu University of Virginia Male
Yasaman Ehsani ehsani58@students.rowan.edu Rowan University Female
Ashwini Prashanth Bhaskar aprashan@usc.edu University of Southern California Female


Several students shared their experiences about SecDev 2022 via email. They found the presentations and tutorials very valuable. We also received feedback the grant was not able to fully cover the expenses within the east and west coast areas. There were also comments on the inability to book reservations at the conference hotel while staying within budget. The conference attempted to find roommates for many of the award recipients.

We believe the NSF travel grant enabled underrepresented students to attend the conference bringing a diversity of thought to the conference that would not have been possible without this travel grant. We consider the conference and the grant to be a success.

We greatly appreciate your understanding and the special effort you undertook to continue to make SecDev accessible to student participants. Positive experiences as students in conferences such as SecDev promote valuable future professional contributions and leadership in venues such as this one.

SecDev 2023 will take place on Oct 18-20, at the Georgia Tech Conference Center in Atlanta, GA. We hope that you or your colleagues are able to stop in and see us.

On behalf of both the 2022 and 2023 SecDev Organizing and Program Committees,

Weihang Wang

weihangw@usc.edu


Last Modified: 07/05/2023
Modified by: Weihang Wang
